that could play a major role in the growth and development of the plant, these
Lysobacter, Pirellula, Steroidobacter, Solibacter, Bryobacter, A17,
There are also several OTUs that are underrepresented in the plants, which
indicate a negative interaction. Some genera like
OTU-specific enrichments and depletions which suggest that the relationships between plant
and bacteria could be species or strain specific.
Complex carbon sources are present in plant-derived photosynthates, and thus metabolic
machinery able to make use of those sources is expected to be present in their associated 510
microbes. These specialized carbon consumers are over-represented species in wild
) which has been described as a typical component
-dominated bogs, they are non-motile and grow well on complex
heteropolysaccharides, glucuronic and galacturonic acids which are residual products of
decay [55]. Other genera highly represented in
has been isolated from soils and plant roots. It
has been shown that some strains like
polysaccharides derived from rhizospheres, and even able to degrade agar. Even more,
was isolated as a commensal strain to a
is capable of denitrifying under anoxic conditions, using nitrate as an 520
electron acceptor and can degrade steroidal hormones as well [57]. Recently,
has been described as part of the core rhizosphere microbiome of the gymnosperm
described as a living 110 million-year-old living fossil [58].
A nutrient rich environment like plant derived photosynthates is certainly attractive also for 525
predators, and bacteria are no exception.
is the best studied of the
genus; it is a sophisticated Gram-negative bacteria predator [59].
